extend.translation[0].definitions[0].def: to continue for a longer period of time, or to make something last longer
extend.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: Management have agreed to extend the deadline.
Some of our courses extend over two years.
The government has extended the ban on the import of beef until June.
extend.translation[0].definitions[1].def: to continue for a particular distance or over a particular area
extend.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: The River Nile extends as far south as Lake Victoria.
The shelf extends 20 cms from the bookcase.
extend.translation[0].definitions[2].def: to make a room, building, road etc bigger or longer
extend.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: We plan to extend the kitchen by six feet.
extend.translation[0].definitions[3].def: to affect or include people, things, or places
extend.translation[0].definitions[3].exa: My duties at the school extend beyond just teaching.
The vote was extended to all women aged 21 and over in 1928.
extend.translation[0].definitions[4].def: to make something affect more people, situations, areas etc than before
extend.translation[0].definitions[4].exa: British Coal is planning to extend its operations in Wales.
We can extend our insurance cover to travel abroad.
extend.translation[0].definitions[5].def: to officially offer someone help, sympathy, thanks etc
extend.translation[0].definitions[5].exa: We’d like to extend a warm welcome to our French visitors.
I’d like to extend my thanks to all the catering staff.
The Coroner extended his sympathy to the victim’s family.
The Headteacher has extended an invitation to the prime minister to visit the school.
The banks have decided to extend credit to the company  (=allow them to borrow more money).
extend.translation[0].definitions[6].def: to stretch out a hand or leg
extend.translation[0].definitions[6].exa: George extended his hand (=offered to shake hands).
extend.translation[0].definitions[7].def: to increase the number of points, games etc by which one person or team is ahead of other competitors
extend.translation[0].definitions[7].exa: Manchester United extended their lead at the top of the table to 10 points.
extend.translation[0].definitions[8].def: if a table or ladder extends, it can be made longer
extend.translation[1].definitions[0].def: to increase the period of time for which an agreement, contract etc is effective
extend.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: The company decided not to extend his employment contract.
The lease has been extended to five years.
extend.translation[1].definitions[1].def: to make something bigger or increase its range
extend.translation[1].definitions[1].exa: Conservationists have successfully blocked a plan to extend the golf course through the woods.
If the program is successful it will be extended to cover the whole country.
extend.translation[1].definitions[2].def: to make credit available to someone
extend.translation[1].definitions[2].exa: This was the first time that banks had extended credit to a Mexican government agency.
